*div1 type="summary"* *p*J. B. Bailey to Austin, August 23, 1825. Commerce. Concerning contract with a Spaniard.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**date_mentioned n="08-23-1825">Ausgust 23.1825*/date_mentioned*.*/p* *p*Sir*/p*
*p*You stated to me in a note [August 17] that the *person_mentioned*Spaniard */person_mentioned*who owed me two horses had deposited his goods in your *location_mentioned*house */location_mentioned*and they should not be allowd. to be carried away until I was paid— but that was not the contract with him and myself—for he was not to remove his goods from my *location_mentioned*house */location_mentioned*until I was paid and I was to be paid some time ago and his contract calls for two Good Young Gentle Horses under Six Years old delivered In my Yard—and I dont wish to be running all over the *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*to collect a debt when It calls to be paid at *location_mentioned*home */location_mentioned*and As his contract was not to remove his goods until I was paid I have let him carry off all but one bail of Irish linen containing 22 pieces—which can be easily packd on A horse when he pays me the two he owes me—and all I want is my contract*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*J. B. Bailey*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Col S F Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
